author: Eric Morath
title: Q&A: Bill Clinton’s Economist Sees Similarities to 2000, But Worries About Differences - Real Time Economics - WSJ
text:
Martin Baily, President Bill Clinton’s top economic adviser the last time the unemployment rate was below 4%, said he sees a lot of similarities between the economy then and now. But he’s more worried about the differences–specifically expanding federal budget deficits and an aging population. Mr. Baily was chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers from […]
